critique: This document is an executive order that amends a previous executive order. It primarily deals with delegating authority related to the Territory of Hawaii, the Virgin Islands, and Alaska to the Secretary of the Interior. There is nothing to suggest any ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to be a matter of internal governmental organization and delegation of powers. The changes regarding the Virgin Islands and drugs could be seen as a very slight move towards economic regulation, but it's minimal. The delegation of authority to the Secretary of Interior could be seen as a slight shift in federalism, but it's not significant. The delegation of authority also doesn't seem to expand executive power in any meaningful way.
